name: Wyndham Orlando Resort

reviews.text: I got a great deal ($55 plus tax) through Priceline and stayed here for a couple days of vacation. I will breakdown the review into different categories for easy reference.
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.text: Location: great location on I-drive, right at the middle. No need to get a car, just utilize the trolley ($1) system. And the food at Perkins restaurant right across is great, although very busy and expect long wait.
reviews.title: Back for a Second Visit, but things have changed
good stay at the wyndham!
reviews.text: Service: So-so, reception offers short answers to questions asked, no extra information. Concierge desk is non-existant. However, they do have an on-site Universal Studios staff if you need to get tickets. But I was impressed by some of the bell staff who were there to give me a ride to my unit/building at check-in.

reviews.title: beware of the wyndam!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: Room: Nice, clean and big. But no frills, only about 10 TV channels. And one night the smoke alarm went off on its own. And our room is on the ground floor, so people can look into our room when they walk by. We had to keep the window closed most of the time to keep privacy.

The property has a resort feel, on a huge property (16 2-story buildings and 3 pools). Overall a very satisfactory stay. I would definitely go back as long as I can get a deal (anything under $70 is worth it).
reviews.title: BEWARE!NASTY DIRTY ROOMS
Housekeeping was the pits
reviews.text: We just got back from a family vacation to Florida. Stayed here 5 nights and there were problems every single day. Ist day they gave us the wrong type of room, I am in a wheelchair and the room they gave us was not accessable. They did not have a handicapped room for us with 2 beds available so they put us in a king and offered to send up a rollaway for our 12 year old. We waited 2 1/2 hours for the rollaway and when I called housekeeping they said they would be there soon! and then hung up on me. Finally 4 hours later the bed arrived. Day 2, no clean towels, when we called housekeeping they said the machine broke down and they had to limit the towels. 2 hours later we received 3 towels from them. Day 3, our bed was changed but they put on dirty sheets with cigarette holes in them...we called and complained and after an hour my husband took the sheets to the lobby(which was crowded and let everyone know what was happening). Man...housekeeping showed up a hurry after that and changed our linens with clean sheets this time. Day 4 we didnt want to take a chance on the sheets being dirty so we kept our do not disturb sign on the door, when I called and asked if we could get clean towels at least they said they would bring them righ up. 3 hours later they finally arrived, and the woman apolagized but said that the person had said that he delivered them hours before. Not once did management apolagize or even comment on all the problems that we had encountered. Its really a shame because the room was beautiful, but with such lowsy service why bother to ever go back.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of June and were unimpressed. The check in looks very plush but whenever we went there was always a queue with usually no more than 2 people behind the desk. Each person in front being served seemed to take an age to sort out so 10-15 minutes wait was not unusual. People would come out from the office behind, look at the queue and go back in again. As we arrived before 4.00pm our room wasn't ready and as we were tired we accepted one that was. Big mistake.It was no more than 2 star in what is supposedly a 4 star hotel. After a miserable night, the morons upstairs liked to walk backwards and forwards over the carpetless floor till 2.00am, we were moved to a room overlooking a lake which was must nicer and more in keeping with a 4 star hotel. If we had have had this room the first night our thoughts might have been different but I doubt it. The hotel is spread over a huge area and you need to drive to your room but it is more a motel than hotel and where the 4 star rating comes from I do not know. We did not eat in the place as there are so many cheaper options on I-drive. The pool looked nice and the pool chairs were comfortable. We are really pleased we were only there for 2 nights and would not go back

reviews.title: Loved It! Fab Spot on I-Drive Too:0)
reviews.text: I cant believe i stayed at the same hotel after reading the reviews! i do travel quite a bit and am very fussy where i stay, spending ages beforehand to make sure my family have a great time and it has been totally worthwhile! We have recently returned from there, and we loved the position on international drive. It is right in the middle so everything is walking destance (we had a hire car but didnt use that on the evenings so my husband can drink so we walked) We passed tons of hotels in the area which we thought were very tatty, out of the way and isolated, so were so pleased when we found ours!

reviews.title: Will never stay in Wyndham again
reviews.text: Never had a problem with staff, it is a huge place spread over a large area so i expect you may get a wait if you are in the lobby a lot but we didnt need it! when we did there were 4 staff on there so we didnt have to wait long at all and they were pleasant. We arrived back to our room a couple of times to find our room wasnt cleaned because some little bugger had turned round the card on the door handle asking them to clean our room but as soon as i phone through to ask them to return to clean it they do no problem at all!

Our room was lovely! 2 double beds in the one room with tv etc, then a small joined hallway with large wardrobe and another tv, then bathroom with shower (ok rubbish bath but who has one in that heat?) All clean, tidy and smart! We stayed in block 6 if that helps, so not sure if there are other blocks that need refurbishing? but i am sure you can request it. There are 2 pools next to each other right next to us with a hot jacuzzi, ice cream/gift shop and bar/food right next to them. Then there is another small pool right next to the lobby for rooms near that?
reviews.title: Mildew, Flies and Noise
Room Type Misrepresented by Reservations
reviews.text: I did not stay at the Wyndham, because of my experience of making a reservation with them.

reviews.title: Good Place
reviews.text: I made a reservation for a room with a king sized bed, and made it clear to the person who took the reservation that a double bed, the other room type available, wouldn't suit me. No problem, she said, made the reservation, and said she'd send a confirmation email.

reviews.title: Would not stay here again
reviews.text: First, I got no confirmation email, like I requested. No problem - I called them back, and asked that they send it. They had my name wrong, and my email address wrong. No problem, I told them the correct one.

When I got the confirmation email finally, it said "two double beds". I'm thinking, no problem, I'll just call them and correct it. But, when I called, suddenly the people I spoke to were distinctly...unfriendly.
reviews.title: Nice place, but some concern...
Bad start but got better
reviews.text: When I got the reservations manager on the line, the story magically changed, and suddenly my reservation for a king sized bed was a "request" - and that bed size could not be guaranteed. I asked to speak to the manager of the property, and she concurred. Despite the fact that I had made what was represented to me as a reservation for a room with a king sized bed, she was not willing to guarantee that one would be available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very bad experience. When we arrived at the lobby, a customer complained that there were being roaches in her room. A good start...
reviews.title: don't go to the Wyndham Resort !

likes.disliked: — quality, housekeeping. Too badly maintained to keep stars and quality label.

reviews.title: Do not be put off - read this first
reviews.text: We stayed in Building 1. Our room was not well cleaned. No roaches...but spiderwebs on walls, dust and waste under the bed and around TV. One cushion was completely torn (by mites?), taps are rusted and impossible to close.
One evening, we ate in the room and left some bread crumbs fall on the ground. The next day bread crumbs were still here.
reviews.title: Don't be too put off
great location
reviews.text: Overall, the resort seems badly maintained.

reviews.title: I will never return
reviews.text: May be the Wyndham was a very good resort in the past but it is not the case now. Walls, furniture, curtains, colors, ground, ...everything seems to be old and badly maintained.

We stayed in Block 10 at the Wyndham. Lovely clean spacious rooms. Could do with a little modernisation but the bathroom and bedroom were very clean. We stayed in block 10 which had patio doors facing out to the pool. The pool area was lovely, plenty of sunbeds and a well stocked towel hut which also provided on loan kiddies toys for the pool.
reviews.title: Highly recommend the Wyndham
Spacious Grounds
reviews.text: The small cafe at the main pool serves lovely coffee and the best ice cream ever.
There is another small cafe at the West Pool area around the lobby area of the hotel, the croissants and salads are delicious. I can highly recommend this cafe.
reviews.title: Wyndham Resort? More like Wyndham Motel!

reviews.text: Very conveniently positioned on I Drive, close to Universal, Beltz Premium Outlets. The gardens are quite lovely, really a lovely oasis in the middle of International Drive.
reviews.title: very good location

reviews.text: I would return to this hotel anytime.
reviews.title: OK for Priceline customers/Block layout map

reviews.text: i stayed at the wyndham from 2-14thru 2-17 07 and overall it was ok i booked thru fairfiled reosrts and had to do a timeshare presentation but it was worth it the room only costs 200 plus free universal passes for 2
reviews.title: it was ok

reviews.text: the grounds were nice 2 pools 1 was heated was the other the heater was broken the game room is small maybe 6 games beware they take more money than stated
reviews.title: Avoid This Hotel at all Costs!

reviews.text: there is a playground for small children and a restaurant on premises
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Wyndham

likes.disliked: — a fridge in the room would have been nice

reviews.text: the location was great off i-4 close to tgifridays -pirate dinner show-golden corral-its right next door to ripleys
reviews.title: Loved swimming in the heated pool

reviews.text: if u dont have a car they have free shuttle to universal and u can walk to a lot of restaurants
reviews.title: Needs Major Improvement

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel and once again I had a wonderful time. I spent 7 nights with a family of five. I had adjoining rooms in building 10 which were spotless and spacious, one was fully carpeted the other had beautiful wood floors with area rugs. The bathrooms aren't the most modern, but they were very clean and well kept. The grounds of the resort are immaculate and serene, the staff as usual were super helpful and always friendly. The resort has 5 pools, and even though the weather was in the 90's most days they were never overcrowded and chairs and towels were always available. The hotel is right on I-Drive with all it's traffic, but you would never even know it. We did Disney and Seaworld while there, and the hotel provided a free shuttle to Seaworld which left on time and picked us up at the park on time. It worked out better to take a cab to the Disney theme parks, cost around $30 each way. The hotel had a paid shuttle to Disney at $15 per person, and you had to call 2 hours ahead of time so they could pick you up at the park, cab ride much easier. Housekeeping did an excellent job, always had lots of towels which was very important with 5 people. My only complaint would be that because the property is so vast, and building 10 was all the way to the other end, it literally took 10 minutes to get to the lobby and front of the hotel. Taxis are allowed to drive right in and let you off at your building, and when we didn't feel like walking we'd hop onto the golfcart with the bellman and he'd take us right to our building. Everything is right nearby the hotel or you can hop on the trolley for $1. Food and ambiance at Ming Court, Bahama Breeze and Wild Jack's is excellent. Also try Tony Roma's on Mondays, it's "all you can eat" rib night, as well as the Premium Outlet mall, great stores and great buys. Don't listen to the negative reviews about this hotel by some people, go see for yourself. I booked my stay through Expedia, seems like many who have complained booked through Priceline at the cheapest rate. Me personally, I can't wait to go back for stay number 3, great job as always Wyndham!!!
reviews.title: Another great stay at the wyndham!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Wyndham for three nights while doing Universal Studios & Seaworld recently. The location is perfect, on International Drive right between the two of them.
reviews.title: Great Location for Universal/Seaworld

reviews.text: The resort itself is more like an upscale motel than a hotel. The rooms were fine and clean, but more motel-style than like hotel rooms. As we were out at the parks all day, this suited us fine... but if you're planning on spending much time there, you might want to upgrade.
reviews.title: loved it!
beautiful property
reviews.text: We didn't really use any of the amenities, but from what we saw the pool area looked nice.
We booked through Hotwire and the total came to $225 for the three nights, which was definitely good value. If you are going to pay more than this though, I'd consider shopping around.
reviews.title: enjoyed our stay
Bed Bugs! Filthy, Filthy, Filthy.
reviews.text: In all my life I have never checked into a more disgusting hotel. I booked this room through priceline and was optimistic based on past experience with the Wyndham brand. I could not have been more wrong. It became immediately apparent that this property was dilapidated and that it was attracting a rather sketchy cliental. When we got to our room the first thing we noticed was a strong musty smell that was overpowering. A few steps in there was a dark red stain about 14" in diameter that looked like it had been there for some time. The windows had not scene windex since the Bush administration and were clouded to the point of obscuring the view out. Walking towards the window I noticed that the AC unit was beige but gray on top, turns out the gray was a think layer of dust. My wife was sitting on the bed and out of concern by the filth I pulled the sheets back to discover four bugs between the sheet and blanket we nearly got ill and immediately grabbed our things and left. As we were walking out we had the pleasure of listening to a fight between the maid staff that involved incredibly loud swearing. We traveled across the street to the Crown Plaza to hopefully book a room for the night. During a discussion with the front desk staff they seemed all to familiar with our situation, apparently they pick up a good amount of walk in business from the Wyndham. Luckily we were able to book a room for the night and had an amazing stay. If you are unlucky enough to "win" this resort on priceline take my advice and consider the money a loss and look for a different resort.

reviews.title: Much Better than Expected
reviews.text: We were very hesitate about staying at this hotel because of all the bad reviews. Glad to say it really was not bad for what we paid through Priceline. Front desk was extremely accommodating and helpful, going so far as printing our airline boarding pass when we were leaving. Room was dated, but clean. Bedding was clean - spotless white duvet and sheets - no bedspread. Bathroom was clean but dated. No mold. No bedbugs or roaches. Very close to Universal.

reviews.title: dirty nasty bad
reviews.text: where do I start maybe at check in when my room wasnt ready and was abruptly told by front desk female manager I was getting free up grade which I didnt ask for but thought they were making up for not having room wrong! given a key for block 16 when opened the door the room was dirty musty and had hair balls and worn furniture.

reviews.title: Great value!
reviews.text: As you can imagine I went straight back and took her aside as not to let any one hear and said what was that room suppose to be if that was an up grade what was I getting she told me to go and come back at 4 which I did ,given block 13 which was slightly better but had no room safe when house keeping brought one they put it next to the tv and put 2 screws in which you could easily unscrew after more complaining given safety box at reception.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - excellent service
reviews.text: This was my 3rd trip to wyndham as have been going to orlando for 15 years and know most hotels sadly the hotel is run down grubby the only positive notes are the grounds and resturaunt I would not advise anyone to waste their money on the hotel as better hotels nearby which cost less like the fairfield by marriott in canada avenue which gives you a lovely clean room and free breakfast every day.

I have been to Orlando several times for business and usually stay on the Sea World end of International Drive. I do not know what I was thinking booking this hotel, located on the busier end of I-Drive right next to Ripley's Believe It or Not. This "resort" truly is undeserving of this title. My room was one of the few that you had to enter from outside, like a motel. It was also facing the street, which allowed street noise to filter in the room. The room was old and in need of renovations, evidenced by the stains on the loveseat and bed throw, the chipped paint and scuffs on the walls and doors, and food crumbs stuck on the promotional info cards on the nightstand. I had to fight with the door to get it open because of a warped door jam. There is a very bright light on the patio of every room that you cannot turn off. The curtain in my room would not completely close, so it might as well would have been daylight in the room when I tried to go to sleep for the evening. The bed was as hard as a rock. The pillows were also too firm and very uncomfortable. The sheets were so thin and stiff, I thought I would get a paper cut. My toilet made a flushing sound every hour on the hour. I did go to the front desk and ask to change rooms, because I couldnt stand it anymore. I should have left. While they did accommodate me with a slightly better room, I still could not wait to leave in the morning. I expect a 3 and 1/2 star "resort" to have a certain level of quality (not luxury obviously, but at least comfortable) and this was underwhelming at best. I did not see the rest of the property, so I cannot comment on anything except my room, which is comment enough. I left in a rush and later in the day realized I kept scratching the back of my neck. After I got home and looked in the mirror, I saw a rash of tiny bumps on the back of my neck. The bumps might as well been formed in the shape of the Wyndham logo. Thank goodness I keep my medicine cabinet fully stocked. Do yourself a favor and pay the extra money to stay on the quiet side of I-drive, sleep in comfort, and steer clear of hotels claiming to be "resorts".
reviews.title: Don't forget to pack your cortisone for the rashes!

reviews.text: My stay at the Wyndham Orlando was excellent all around. The staff was very helpful and attentive to all our needs. I would absolutely come back to this superb hotel.
reviews.title: My stay was comftorable, enjoyable and excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just back from a lovely holiday. Was worried after reading all the bad reviews about dirty rooms and bed bugs, but was happy not to have encountered any of these problems. Yes the place was massive but when we arrived we were offered to be taken to our room by the bell boy. All staff were really helpful and friendly. the grounds were lovely, yes the room could have used some fresh paint but other than that no other bad words about the room.
reviews.title: Dont believe bad reviews

reviews.text: the hotel was perfectly located, would definately stay again.
reviews.title: bad customer service not very clean

reviews.text: rates were wrong. We needed to get new room keys 3 or more times because they kept having to be reprogrammed. Dirty toilet and tub. No refill on regular coffee. Maids always were using the elevator so we had to wait a long time. Elevators very dirty. Walking pavers were loose and we tripped on many of them. No kids activities given at check in and then finally they gave us a list but they were all done for the week. When making the reservation it said kids eat free with an adult but when checking it they said we did not qualify for this. They also said free internet but it was only free access if we brought our own. Resort fee is crazy being you don't even get the things they offer, everything is an upcharge or extra fee. Ice machine was out of ice. Bad hotel for $ paid:(
reviews.title: Exceptional value for money. LOVE IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just like a lot of travelers writing the reviews, I read a lot of negative reviews and was a bit nervous about booking it but actually trusting my gut and booking it was the smartest move! we requsted a king size room and we got it. the rooms are spacious and pretty nice. the rooms are satisfactory but the best thing about this hotel is that it's property. there are 3 great pools and at least one of them is not packed. there is a hot tub as well as ping pong table, fooseball and pool table that you can play for free. there are other amenities like beach balls and games for the pool. the health club is great. if you do work out, the gym and equipment is pretty nice! sauna is really nice after the work out. the locker rooms in the health club are great too and they have lotions, razors, deodarants, hair gel and other products for your use if you forget something at home. all of these little touches made for a great stay! the location is great. you can walk to everything nearby including wet n wild, ripleys believe it or not, great buffets in the area, etc. the i-drive bus takes you where you need to go as well and a whole day unlimited ride pass is $3.
reviews.title: The most beautiful resort ever!

likes.liked: — the beautiful locations and wonderful amenities.

reviews.text: this hotel is great and i recommend it to everybody! my husband and i loved it and we would come back !
reviews.title: Rooms sub-Wyndham Quality...Beautiful Resort

likes.liked: — The beautiful gardens, lagoons and pools.

reviews.text: This is truly a beautiful, well-maintained and expansive resort in a GREAT location with tons of outdoor entertainment for adults and children alike. However, the rooms are rather disappointing despite the hardwood floors. The linens, furniture and window AC/heat unit were very mid-price motel in quality; I have come to expect much more luxury from Wyndham in my hotel room.
reviews.title: Dont believe the bad reviews it is great

likes.disliked: — book the breakfast option with expedia also ask for an upstairs room at the pool if you have kids

reviews.text: One really major issue with me was in the "mythical" Orange County Convention Center shuttle which we never were able to ride. The hotel advertises this and even shows the pickup area on its hotel map that is given to all that check-in, yet no one seems to know when or if it picks up. On one occasion, we waited in 100 degree heat for 30 minutes because we were told that it was running. It wasn't until I flagged down two other employees that I finally was told that it was not running today. Needless to say...I never saw it running!
reviews.title: Greatest Hotel Ever

reviews.text: I read the reviews and they put me off a bit. We stayed 3 years ago and loved it and being honest it is still great value, very clean and for breakfast if you book through expedia great value.
reviews.title: Dont listen>>>Great Hotel

likes.liked: — good location for all theme parks but lovely friendly clean and comfortable accomadation

reviews.title: What a nightmare!!!
reviews.text: First of we arrived at the hotel i thought it looked very nice and posh. Me and my partner went to check in and it took a very long time, she kept going to the back and coming out to speak to us and after all that waiting she couldn't find our reservation even though we had our reservation number! so we sorted it out the NEXT morning and we were put in a room that we didnt even book, we wanted a balcony room with a king sized bed but no we were placed in block 9 the furthest away its ridiculous. the bath tubs are horrible and disgusting you could feel the dead skin left in the bath its horrible. to top it all off one of my rings went missing which i took off when i went for a shower, i turned the place upside down to try and find it but no luck. i wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, well not for the price anyway. it was mine and my partners first holiday together and what a let down it was.

reviews.title: not worth the money
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there for a convention. The convention rooms were large and everything went well with it.

reviews.title: Poor Representation of a Wyndham Resort - Dated and Well Used
reviews.text: Check in was long- about 20 minutes. We had to drive to our rooms from the lobby. We were given directions as where to park but we found another lot closer to our building and room.
The room was small but clean. We could hear the people next door and it kept us awake on the first night. We often heard the slamming of doors. Not a quiet place!
reviews.title: excellent hotel
you're on a warning!
reviews.text: Our card keys didn't work late one night and we had to walk to the front desk to inform them that our keys wasn't working. they gave us new keys- they didn't work. they sent security and they said the lock needed new batteries. We waited around 20 minutes for staff to come and fix the lock.

Our stay at the Wyhdham was great. The staff was nice at check- inn. The room was CLEAN, which is a big pet peeve of mine. You could tell they have a lot of traffic in the rooms, you have to remember it is Orlando. The hardwood floors helped in the cleanliness area, no nasty carpet. The decor was nice and the price was better, only $65.
reviews.title: Great Priceline catch

likes.liked: — The clean room and the location

reviews.text: The location is great for a day at the park or just enjoying International Drive. You don't have to look for a place to eat, everything is right in front of your face.
reviews.title: Expensive for what it is.

likes.disliked: — No fridge or microwave' needs redecorating.

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again!!

reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever...
reviews.text: Just got back from a 10 day holiday from Orlando Florida.

reviews.title: Delighted i stayed here again
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wyndham Orlando Resort on first impressions it were favourable checking in was prompt although the receptionist tried to get us to take a golf cart to our room which was only a five minute walk away,I think just so we would part with a dollar to tip the driver.

I just returned March 5, 2007, from a 5 night stay at the Wyndham and found the resort to be impeccably clean and comfortable. I was on business at the convention center and meals that were served were excellent. I stayed in Bldg 12 close to the main pool. The main pool was not heated so I chose to use the smaller pools and they were warm. The grounds were beautiful and I felt like I was in a tropical resort on an island, not just off a busy tourist strip. I paid the AAA rate of $79 a night and would stay here again. The bathroom was a standard hotel bath, but is was clean and in excellent condition. The bed was comfortable. This hotel is not convenient to Disney, but if you are going to Seaworld or Universal, the I-Ride trolley runs right by the hotel every 10 min or so, and will take you there for $1. My colleagues all had similar clean, comfortable experiences, I do not understand the complaints written by previous reviewers.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, nice room

reviews.text: Just got back. Rooms were just fine. Large and clean enough. Landscaping was awesome, especially the pool and pool bar area. Location was excellent on Intl Drive. I don't understand the negative reviews at all. It's not perfect but definitely exceeded my expectations after the reviews I read. Great for the price.
reviews.title: Don't worry, it's just fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stay her in August last year, and i have got too say that we loved it! I dont think that the rooms were a 4* but they were fine for the amount of time that we spent in them, and the bed was VERY comfy!! As for the hotel itself, the grounds were beautiful and they ducks were a lovely touch! All in all we thought that the hotel was very good, great location, beautiful grounds and a great rate. We would definetly stay here again.
reviews.title: We loved it!
Dirty and unhygenic
reviews.text: Booked our holiday through Virgin Holidays and was a bit worried due to all the negative reviews I had read. I had need to worry as most of the reviews were accurate. Paid extra for a suite as needed more space for our family of 4. The bathroom was so tiny the door would not open fully and banged against the toilet. The coffee maker with cups etc was kept in the bathroom, next to the toilet! Stains all over the room. Dirt all along the skirting board and actual bits all over the floor. Dirty walls, stains on the bedsheets in the kidsuite, Wires hanging down that could be tripped over. There was also a horrible musty smell. Moved to the only other room available which was just the same but did not smell as bad. Needless to say we only stayed one night and Virgin moved us to an alternative property. Due to the builders convention had the choice of only 2 hotels though. we were just glad to be somewhere clean. The Wyndham was rated as 4 in the Virgin brochure which may be for facilities on offer but certainly is not for cleanliness. I've stayed in better 2/3 star properties. We were in a block right near the main road of International Drive which was very noisey.

I have just returned from a four night stay at this resort (Feb. 19th - 23rd 2007). What a disappointment! Rooms were crummy being quite old and still having $125 tvs. Toliet didn't work having to open lid everytime to flush. No fridge, no microwave, and where did that ice machine go? All for $195 a night plus a gazillion taxes. The worst part was the attitude of the staff. They just plain seemed put out because they had to help you. Not all of them but clearly the majority. All they really wanted was your money. Even the bellboy got upset because I wanted to walk to my room. They got the attitude that they can book in any convention group they want and just don't need you there. I doubt I will ever use Wyndham again anywhere but like I said earlier. I just don't think they care.
reviews.title: Avoid at all Cost
Only 45 minutes and that was on the phone booking another hotel---45 minutes too long
reviews.text: Believe the tripadvisor reviews,, ,this place is a total dump. The resort is massive and you they tell you they have hotel transportation from one building to another...but trust me... they piddle and work at looking busy and the English of the people that work here are horrible. The rooms are dated and disgusting, they smell like Clorox bleach,, I could feel my skin burn upon entering the room...if it tells you anything..we did not even look at the bathroom..dont know what was behind the shower curtain and dont care. I would rent a car and sleep in it before staying at this place. Oh.. and the best part...you will hear that they cannot guarantee a bed bug free hotel..once you see the place you will know why.

reviews.title: Clean
reviews.text: Carme cleaned our room beautifully and happily. The sheets were changed, clean towels, coffee, tea, and cups.

reviews.title: Not a Resort
reviews.text: Hotel boasts as being a resort, the facility is far from being what we call a resort. It was adequate for our needs and was priced fairly. Beware of hidden resort fees...which we found to be ridiculous, fee covers parking costs, access to Starbucks Coffee (they have those on every corner) and access to Haagen Das ice cream parlor and the ability to use an in room safe. Facility was just ok in my opinion.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Love this place, first off they have three heated pools (although one was broken at the time) and a hot tub. The pool side bar gave drinks in plastic cups so you could walk around the resort with them. The price was very reasonable. The front desk was very accommodating to our need to be close to a another group that we were traveling with. The outdoor walkway could be loud at times, but nothing above the usual when there are inconsiderate people are around. The location was great, right near a bunch of attractions on I-Drive.

reviews.title: RUDE
reviews.text: The worker there was rude. The lady that check us in made us stay outside in the cold and didn't even invite us inside the building. Then the second lady came and just just scare at my family and kid. She didn't even greet us or smile at us. When she ask us questions she asked with an attitude. Not even once did she talk or smile at my kids.The place is not very clean nor the worker are not very friendly!!!

reviews.title: Need to clean up the rooms
reviews.text: This was our first experience at a Wyndham resort, and I must say, I was prettty disappointed. Check-in was smooth - we arrived on a Friday evening after a very long day at Universal Studios with two sleeping children in the car. We found the room easily and parking was not a problem, although traffic on International Drive was horrendous (we happened to be in Orlando the weekend of the Daytona 500). Upon entering the room, only 2 of the 3 lamps in the main area worked. It was nice to have a separate area for the kids, but my husband was concerned that there was a hardwood floor in the room with the bunkbeds, if, God forbid, either of them fell out. I also noticed that the walls were very thin as we could hear noise from all the other rooms around us. It was a very cold weekend in Orlando, so we turned on the "low heat " function on the very old fashioned "motel" looking air conditioning unit. The ventilation was awful and the room got way too hot and dry - both my husband and I had trouble sleeping because of the room's climate. The next morning, I noticed the mildew all over the outside of the shower curtain. I also was pretty creeped out by the small bug/roach that came by under the air conditioner. When we returned from Disney for a nap-break for the kids that afternoon, I noticed that the room had not been swept/vacuumed well as I still saw Pop-tart crumbs under the table from my boys' breakfast. I also noticed a LOT of dust bunnies under one of the side tables. The resort's website said that laundry facilities were available in each building. I did need to wash a couple of items, so I went looking for the washers and dryers. The "facility" was simply one washer and one dryer basically sitting outside in one of the hallways. No laundry soap machine was nearby, but laundry soap could be purchased at the gift shop in the middle of the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I am somewhat wary of hotels as far as cleanliness, but I have to say, this was one of the most disappointing experiences I have ever had. Thankfully, we paid for this hotel with a bunch of credit card reward points, so we didn't actually pay out of pocket. Unless they make some major changes in housekeeping and maintenance, I would avoid this "resort".
reviews.title: Good Location.....Not a 4 star

likes.liked: — Leaving it to go to the theme parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After previously staying at the Quality Inn Plaza on i-drive we thought we would upgrade to something better, hence our stay at the Wyndham. Frankly there was not a great difference between the two. Both had slightly damp, unclean rooms. I found out how unclean when chasing a cockroach around the back of the fittings and cabinets for an hour one night (this was after it left the bed!). The room was a mirror of the lower rated Quality Inn Plaza hotel (which is cheaper by a lot) and if its just a room you are after both are the same. The facilities at the Wyndham were better though with good swimming pools and an excellent buffet breakfast room. We noticed some rooms near the pool which looked newer, but perhaps these are not for the brits on holiday! There were so many 'convention' business people around sometimes I felt I was in a working environment and not on 'vacation'. If we go again I think I will consider a Disney hotel since they have a reputation to maintain and I am unimpressed with the cleanliness of the i-drive 'motels'
reviews.title: Loved the Wyndham!!
Motel NOT a 4* star hotel as sold by major uk agent!
reviews.text: This place was very nice, especially for the price. Staff was very friendly, room was clean. It is an older place, but looks like it has been remodeled in recent times. The grounds were beautiful, lots of ponds. The pools were never crowded. Close to attractions. The biggest problem was that we drove to Universal Studios and came back late and there wasn't much parking left. Had to walk a long ways back to our room. All in all a very nice experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not go near!
reviews.title: Good time in Orlando!!!! Chicago, IL
Not as bad as I was expecting
reviews.text: Stayed here for a convention and was really worried because of all the bad reviews. Here is my experience: There were several people in front of me checking in so I had time to observe the hotel staff as I stood in line. Both guys working the desk were very nice to guests, smiling and going out of there way to make us feel special. He explained to us that there was a $10 daily charge for internet in the rooms or it was free if we were Wyndham by Request Members. It was free to sign up to be Members so we did. He gave us a blue ethernet cord and explained we needed to be sure and bring it back to the front desk when we check out. We were given Room 1346 in Block 13, bottom floor. Upon entering the room, the first thing my husband and I did was pull back the sheets & check the bed for bugs. None were found. The sheets were very clean and looked new. The room smelled a little musty, but it was not too bad. We opened the sliding door to get the smell out. The back sliding door of this room looked out to a pretty lagoon. The front door opened up to an interior corridor. The bathroom is very small with one sink. The faucet was backwards, cold water was to the left and hot to the right. Same as the bathtub. By the end of the week we got used to it. The tub was a bit old and had marks in it making it look dirty. There is a safe in the room big enough to put your laptop in with a charging station. Our room did not have a fridge but my friend's room in Block 14 did. Bed was comfortable enough, although it was nothing at all like my Tempurpedic at home. Decor was okay, just like you see in the pictures. I spent a lot of time at the pools. Two large pools and hot tub are in the middle of the complex along with ping pong and pool tables. The largest pool had plenty of seating and shade. There is also a small kiddie pool, bathrooms and a restaurant called Gatorville in this area. Pool #2 was slightly smaller but still big. It had an ice cream & coffee shop beside it and also the health complex. The workout room is pretty well equipped and had more than what you would normally find in a hotel. There was a guy doing P90X in there and several others on the machines who seemed to enjoy the room. Spa services were also available. The 3rd pool was called the West pool and was at one end of the resort, outside the restaurant Augustine's. This pool is not heated so I was able to enjoy a whole day being the only one using it. Everyone else was at the other 2 heated pools. There were plenty of nice lounge chairs and tables at all 3 pools. Breakfast buffett at Augustine's was $12.95. It was pretty good, nothing bad there. The Convention Center was nice and big and had free internet access. They have a free shuttle going to Universal at 8, 10, and noon. Housekeeping knocked on our door 9am every morning and were very kind when I wasn't ready to leave the room. One morning, the housekeeper must not have heard me answer her knock because she walked right into the room with me standing there in my underwear. She said sorry and excused herself. Scared the crap outta me but I got over it. One thing I didn't like was the strong smell of bleach in the tub. Oh well, at least it was clean.

reviews.title: Minor problems...but quick fix!
reviews.text: The airlines had broken the latch on my hubby's golf bag. He called front desk looking for some pliers at midnight. They were gonna try to find one for him. In the mean time, he went outside and saw a worker on a golf cart. Hubby asked the guy if he could borrow some pliers or a leatherman. The guy was so nice and stood outside in the hall helping my husband fix his hard shell golf bag. 10 minutes later they were done. Hubby gave him a $5 tip just for being kind and the guy thanked him and said he wasn't expecting anything.

reviews.title: Comfortable mid range motel-style accommodation just off I4 and I-Drive
reviews.text: So overall, my fears were put to rest about this hotel. The hotel is nice in some areas and okay in others. It's a fairly large complex but still walkable, and the grounds are pretty. There were people always working on the grounds every day. It wasn't the most swank hotel I've stayed in, but definitely not the worst either. Just middle of the road. If Wyndham updated everything, then I would be able to say that this place would be awesome. But until then, it's fine. Thankfully we had a good experience and will be back.

reviews.title: had a lovely time, just don't go to guest services unless you want a timeshare
reviews.text: My husband and I picked this hotel for several reasons. 1. we are employees of another Wyndham property. 2.We have been here before and had on OK stay. 3. It is a resort and there are plenty of things to do. 4. It LOOKS REALLY NICE in the pictures.

reviews.title: Not a typical hotel
reviews.text: We arrived with our 2 dogs and got put in a handicap king...which was OK with us, we understood since we had dogs that is probably what they had to do. BUT my husband crawled in bed and started inspecting the sheets and found a black thing...I told him it looked like a dried up mascara, and he pulled back the sheets and a HUGE spider crawled out!! We called and requsted new sheets at like 12AM it took them 1hour @least to change the sheets for us. The next morning we asked to change rooms, the manager was very nice and moved us quickly...with an upgrade! Side note: The room next to us was under construction and that is where the spider probably came from. We probably will not stay here again but it is a OK property and needs a few upgrades the rooms are very noiisey and you hear EVERYTHING at night. The staff were very nice and fixed what they could. Another thing I was not pleased with...NO WIFI in the rooms. Plus you have to pay for the regular internet $10 per day!! the breakfast buffet is like $12.50 a prson and it is not that good!

description: The Wyndham Orlando Resort welcomes you to an unforgettable stay in the heart of Orlando’s famous theme parks and attractions. Wyndham Orlando Resort is a tropical paradise filled with lush gardens and three gorgeous swimming pools. Guests can also take advantage of a fitness center, jogging path, game room and on-site dining options. Wyndham Orlando Resort offers shuttle service to Wet n’ Wild, Universal Studios, Sea World, and Walt Disney World.
